will complete the last stitch of the old color the quickest way to do this is to simply yo with the new color and pull through i want to expand on this just a little bit with a better way of securing the loose ends using the yarns themselves to create a kind of twist whose friction holds the ends together figure 1613 changing colors using the yarn twist method when you yo yo with both the old and the new color then pull through while making sure that the new color is on top hook into the new color on the hook pull it through the old color then do the same thing vise-versa so you pull the old color through the new lastly remove the hook and reinsert it through the bottom to catch the new color and pull it through the old color one more time when you pull the loose ends tight the twist will get pulled into the stitch but they will be secured together not permanently but good enough to be stable until you can weave in your ends i like this method because though it might not give the same level of security as a square knot it is practically invisible when it gets pulled into the stitch copyright © 2025 by megyn burnett all rights reserved this pattern is for personal use only this
